$!You may need to tell DVLA if you have branch retinal vein occlusion.$!
   
%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don't tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you're involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence

###Branch retinal vein occlusion in one eye only

You don't need to tell DVLA if the condition affects one eye only and you're still able to meet ['visual standards for driving'](/driving-eyesight-rules "Driving eyesight rules").

###Branch retinal vein occlusion in both eyes

You must tell DVLA if the condition affects both eyes. Fill in form V1 and send it to them. The address is on the form.

$D [Download 'V1 - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 260KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065620.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form V1V and send it to them. The address is on the form.

$D [Download 'V1V - Confidential medical information' (PDF, 261KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065275.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You may need to tell DVLA if you have branch retinal vein occlusion - if so, download the correct form to let them know
title: Branch retinal vein occlusion and driving
